message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.SP. 

The paper deals with signal processing and image reconstruction using compressive sensing techniques, which are typically studied in the Information Theory (cs.IT) and Signal Processing (cs.SP) sub-categories. The specific application of image reconstruction suggests that Computer Vision (cs.CV) may also be a relevant sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of optimization techniques such as $\ell_1$-minimization and total variation minimization, which are commonly studied in the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the development of a new framework for measuring coherence in sparse recovery problems, which may be of interest to researchers in the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
